Reviews.Title: “This hotel knows service!”
Reviews.Author: ML_LondonUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Hotellino. I have travelled a lot all over the world, and stayed in many, many hotels. Hotellino is definitely in my top 5 favorite hotel experiences because of the level of service and friendliness of the owners. So many hotels try to nickle-and-dime you these days, but Hotellino understands that the value of happy customers is much greater than making an extra 1 lira on a bottle of water. The great things about Hotellino: free wifi throughout the hotel, 3 free bottles of water per day, free (included) breakfast buffet with many hot item food choices, and best of all, free advice and travel recommendations from the hotel owners. The owner Mina (sp?) speaks with all the guests every morning and offers advice on the best things to see, eat, and do every day. She knows Istanbul very well and was able to give us many recommendations for less touristy places, and she and her husband helped us make reservations and plan our itinerary each day we were there. She is not pushy at all - it truly feels like being welcomed into someone's home, and they want to make you feel comfortable and enjoy your stay. For example, a friend of ours was staying at another nearby hotel, and Mina invited him to join us for breakfast (for free) every morning of our stay. Remarkable hospitality. The hotel meets all the basic requirements as well - it is very conveniently located to the major attractions, 24-hour check in for late arrivals, rooms are very clean and modern, beds are comfortable, minibar, in-room coffee making facility, in-room safe, good air-conditioning system in the rooms, and our room on the 4th floor was quiet. There are hundreds of hotels in Istanbul, but don't look any further - you will be happy with Hotellino. If I ever return to Istanbul, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotellino”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn M
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the super Hotellino hotel. Great little hotel, staff were so helpful. Room was very nice,clean and comfortable. Good buffet breakfast. Good location, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc all within walking distance. Would definitely stay there again and would reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Hotel owner was lovely. Marilyn Didcot Oxfordshire England

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sonni28
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is small, family owned and in a good location where everything is in a walking distance. If you go on a city trip, this should be considered to avoid fares for transport. We had a room on the 5th floor. There was a small balcony to step on with a nice view to GÃ¼lhane Park, Galata Tower etc. We should have chosen a room with 2 beds, since our bed was small (we are tall people). Then there was a construction site on Sirkeci train station that was very loud the whole night, there was a disturbing noise from trucks going backwards. Can't blame the hotel for that since the noise was in the whole area. Generally it is clean, but with very little effort it could be cleaner. We found foreign hair on the floor when stepping in our room for the first time, one window had stains that were obvious and were not removed during our 5-days- stay and will be there now I guess. Thats not a big deal for a cleaning person with eyes in the head, right? And when you encounter stains like that you start asking yourself about the cleanliness in the whole room. Gives a bad feeling. Breakfast was great, there was everything you needed. We liked the sesam-rings very much. If they ran out of someting it was refilled immediately. Good service also on the reception and good information by the owners, although it was a bit weird on Sunday, when " the boss" was there. Breakfast room was crowded and he was walking up and down the buffet all the time....desperatly trying to give information. It depends what you pay for the room if the hotel can be recommended. For us this relation was ok for Istanbul city center for that Easter holiday time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vashisht S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel from Jan.30 thru Feb 2nd, 2012 and will always reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. It has a great location and close to top attractions. The staff and the owner speak English, are very hospitable, people friendly and willing to help you in case you have a problem. I encountered one medical problem and was helped by everyone of the staff. Hotel , though boutique is relatively new and has very clean rooms/BR and serves very good BF. I will highly reccomned this Hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotellino my casa in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KingfisherOslo
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice in a small street close to most attractions in Istanbul. Nice clean room, good bed and pretty much all you need. Complimentary water, coffee/tea etc. Good breakfast. Very serviceminded at front desk. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic -- great value -- no reason to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Noah W
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with the Hotellino. The location is perfect, within easy walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc etc. Also only 2 blocks from a very convenient tram which will take you wherever you need to go for 2 TL. My room on the 4th floor was as nice as any $100+ room in the USA. The shower was excellent. Breakfast is included and was delicious -- lots of fresh vegetables, cheeses, meats, and 2 hot entrees. The owner of the hotel is a very friendly woman who will introduce herself to you at breakfast and help you with a customized itinerary in Istanbul based on how long you are staying. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I paid about 40 Euro per night. If it were 100 Euro per night, I would still rate this 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: skyskylee
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in this nice little hotel last October. It is very conveniently located, between the Sirkeci and Gulhane tram stops (you can use either) and close to the Sirkeci train station and ferry piers. You can walk to most of the sights on this side of the harbour if you don't mind walking. I arrived late at night and it took a while and some asking for directions to find the hotel because it was at a side street among many other side streets next to the tramline. Luckily even at about 11PM the streets were quite well lit with some shops / restaurants open so it did not feel unsafe for me to walk alone. I noted the next day that there was indeed signage pointing to the hotel on the way from the Sirkeci tram stop but it was not obvious or easy to see. The directions on the hotel's website were very useful. The room I had was comfortable and had everything I needed. OK bed, clean bathroom, fridge with free bottled water, electric kettle, TV with international news channels, and wifi. The only thing that I was not completely happy with was that it was on the first floor (one floor above the ground level) and right next to my window there was a bright neon sign of the hotel next door. So I had to keep the curtains drawn tight and there was a little noise from the street (just a little, not annoying). The breakfast was adequate and the staff/manager were very friendly. The lady manager seemed to make it a point to greet and chat with different guests during breakfast time every morning, and she was helpful. Overall the hotel was of good value of money and my stay was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect little hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pageauf
Reviews.Content: If you are a seasoned traveler, I challenge you not to like Hotellino. Great location close to Hagya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar; cute and well provided little rooms, spotless and modern bathrooms, very reasonable rates, and above all, an owner - Mine - who truly enjoys helping clients appreciate the city and taking time to make sure you will have a memorable experience. And the included breakfast offers a great variety of fresh and tasty items. Yes, it is in a very touristy section of the city, but hey, isn't it why most of us go to Istanbul? Stop shopping around for a better deal and go to Hotellino.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cobbler1
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from 4 nights at this lovely boutique hotel in Sirkeci in the old part of Istanbul. The last visit to Istanbul was 15 years ago so was keen to re-visit. The flight with Easyjet into Sabiha Gokcen Airport was superb. Then the Havas bus into Taksim and a bus then down to the waterfront opposite Sirkeci Station and then a very short walk to the hotel. The hotel is in a very quiet back street and our room on the top (5th) floor had a superb view over the rooftops towards the Bosphorus (unfortunately a dingy multi-storey car park blocked what could be an even better view). The room was very spacious with a small balcony and a fully fitted bathroom with everything you needed plus free bottles of water in fridge. The breakfast in the little front cafe was superb with a splendid array of food and drink and the staff so willing to help. Unfortunately we never met the owner. A short walk up to the tram station Gulhane took you anywhere you needed to go. With a dodgy knee found this the best form of transport and purchased the Istanbul card which enabled travel on tram, bus, train, ferry and funicular. Istanbul isn't geared up for disabilities so you do have to take care. There are loads of restaurants around the hotel if you can get past the owners who stand outside in all weathers trying to entice you in but it is all meant in good humour. I would thoroughly recommend the Lino for anyone visiting this beautiful, vibrant colourful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: susane07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotellino twice and each time was lovely. While the rooms are small, they are clean, fine, quiet and have wonderful soaps, free water, etc. for guests. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. It was very conveniently located to many restaurants and sites - extremely walkable. We had a lovely time at this hotel and in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Hotellino home from home”
Reviews.Author: alexnar
Reviews.Content: Want to thank the owner for all her help and suggestions and all the staff who were friendly, professional and always keen to offer advice. The Hotel is very central just 5 minutes walk from the Station and 10 from the ferry boats. Istanbul is a megalopolis much changed in the 15 years since I last visited. Confident, busy, with a mostly efficient transport system (if you don't take the car or bus) this is a city in full boom. I guess thats why there was construction going on all around us and all hours of the day. Perfect combination of sun in the sky and snow on the ground, winter in Istanbul is one to cherish.

Reviews.Title: “Return is inevitable”
Reviews.Author: Lilmarlou
Reviews.Content: Although this review is well overdue, I had to put my word of support toward Hotellino. Staff are great, helpful, friendly and considerate. I dont think the owner can be any more helpful... if so i think she would escort you around Istanbul!!! Youare brilliant.... Breakfast is great, the only problem is that with so much to choose i think i put one a KG or 2 while i was there!!! hahahaha (i cant blame you for your greed). The decor is refreshing - as 'personally' i find some of the traditional Turksih decor in hotels 'not my cuppa tea'... Hotellino is stylish, cool and clean. At the time we were there we had our 1 year old daughter with us, and as all with little ones know travelling can be made very hard. Hotellino were fantastic, and catered for all our 'picky' needs. Great location, easy to move around..... We would recommend it to all, and have already had our family stay there when in Istanbul. Well done - thank you - see you soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but first-class”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family (4 adults) in March 2011 and would not hesitate to use the hotel again. The staff were friendly and helpful - they enabled us to check in early, stored our big bags whilst we did an overnight tour to Gallipoli and Troy, and opened the kitchen over an hour early so that we could have breakfast before we departed. I thoroughly recommend the breakfast as well. The location was fantastic and is an easy walk to Topkapi Palace & Blue Mosque. If I had one complaint it would be that the hotel is a bit small and the rooms tight, but that was little price to pay. It just meant that they were cosy and warm - a must for Istanbul in early March.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Istanbul's old city downtown”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaButorina
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has very nice pleasant atmosphere. Location is perfect on the quiet side street from tramvay line, Sirkeci tram stop is just 2 min by walking, Eminonu ferry station is 5 min by feet, all Sultanahment attractions such as Blue Mosque, Saint Sophia, Basilica Cictern etc. are only in 10 min walking distance. Rooms are very clean and quite capacious, all necessary amenities such as sleepers&bathrobes are included. Free wifi on the whole hotel's territory. Breakfast is good with plenty choice of pastries, cornflakes, vegetables, fruits, etc. Hotel's staff is very polite and helpful. Every morning's conversation with the owner while having breakfast is a good tradition of this hotel. I'm absolutely satisfied with my choice of Hotellino and highly recommend it to everyone. Obviously the place number one to stay in for visiting Istanbul. Thank you Hotellino, you made my Istanbul's vacation truly enjoyable. Christina Moscow, Russia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: miablee
Reviews.Content: Hotellino was an excellent boutique hotel. We were met by receptionist Susan who did a fantastic job at accommodating us and making sure we had everything we needed. I felt that we bombarded her with questions and requests for help but she was always happy to help. Mine was a great hostess who gave us helpful hints around the city during our morning breakfasts, which was pretty large as far as choices go. The room itself was great. The walls are a little thin but the rooms are clean, there was some maintenance issues (grates needed screwing into the walls, bathtub base fell out when the door hit it. But otherwise it was a nice room. The hotel is in the center of it all so stay here if you want to be walking distance between everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hitting all the right notes”
Reviews.Author: MichoacanChi
Reviews.Content: I recently returned home to Hong Kong after spending seven nights at Hotellino. I don't know where to start my praise of this chic boutique hotel in the very heart of Sultanahmet, Istanbul. My third-floor room was lovingly appointed, spotlessly clean and immensely comfortable. The breakfast included in the price was delicious and filled with a variety of foods to satisfy all types of palates. The staff was polite and efficient. And the hotel's location is within easy walking distance of Istanbul's leading historic sites. I will save my greatest praise for the owner. Every morning at breakfast she would check in with me, offer hints about where to go and, just as importantly, where to avoid. She was as knowledgeable about the cheapest taxi fares as she was about the collections at the Istanbul Modern Art Museum. When she wasn't speaking English with me, she was helping someone else in Turkish or French. A lovely woman. I'm struggling to find anything negative to say about Hotellino. I guess I could criticize the views - there are none - at least from the third floor. But then, maybe those lack of views is also what makes the hotel so incredibly quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: MommyRandSonW
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staffs were very friendly and very sweet. Me and my 4 years old son had a great time in Istanbul because of this temporary home base there :) Rebecca

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Eminonu”
Reviews.Author: ioape
Reviews.Content: Hotellino Is a very nice hotel in Eminonu -Sircesi area! The room was clean as also big for one person. It was modern decorated, with a nice window from the bath having a view in to the room, which can be also closed (see the photos). The service was excellent with international TV, three bottles of water free. Also by the question how to go to the airport, the offer you the alternative with the shuttle bus (7â‚¬), although the hotel has also a taxi service.Â  The service was good with muesli, fresh fruits, scrambled eggs, different kinds of bread, fresh cut tomato and cucumbers, where you do not have to have the impression that they spend at least one night cut in the plate. Personnel is friendly helping you bu any inquiry. As negative I would note the big construction Site next to the hotel as Â also the simple window glass in the bath. After 08:00 it seems impossible to sleep! I booked through an Internet hotel service and it seems for me that the price for a single room, it was more than fair! For such a rate of course I would book again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at the very center of the city”
Reviews.Author: tkokoshi
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotellino was perfect. The staf was very helpful and the breakfast was exellent. The room was very confortebal & clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Hotellino through a travel package, I was very wary before check-in but our stay was perfect! The staff was incredibly helpful, the breakfast buffet was very good. The location was exceptional. One of the people on the tour with us had a birthday during the stay and the hotel ordered a cake complete with candles and sparklers. Advise on sites was given and "taksi" drivers were hailed, the staff (owner) came outside to make sure the driver knew where we were going. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with the warmest hospitality”
Reviews.Author: zephyrous
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern and chic. It was extremely comfortable. But it was the hospitality of the owners which really warmed us to the place. We arrived at 6am and our check-in was supposed to be at noon. When we enquired on breakfast places in the vicinity, they offered us breakfast at the cafe, simply because we were their guests even though we hadn't officially checked in. This you will never experience in any international chain hotels. When we were done with breakfast, one of the owners noticed we were without a room and had just come in on the red eye. And she let us check in 3 hours ahead of our check-in time. We were extremely grateful. On top of that, the owners make an effort to visit the breakfast room daily to check in on guests if they need any travel advice or assistance and were incredibly helpful. This is the only option when I return to Istanbul and should be yours too.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: NannyBAbingdon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly situated for a shopping weekend in Istanbul. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was good. Tea and coffee in the rooms, also a small fridge and flat screen TV. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and I'd be very happy to go back. The beds were extremely comfortable, as were the pillows - somewhat rare in many hotels I've stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and calm hotel, in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mayya_d_z
Reviews.Content: We travelled with my husband in November 2011, I was amazed by the hotel, it's very homy and cosy. Room is very spacious, pleasantly decorated and has all thar is necessary. However, I would appreciate also having iron and ironing board. Hotel situation is perfect, it's on a quiet street and very close to Gulhane Park and all sightseeings. Tram station Sirkeci is also very close, or you can walk to Gulhane tram station. View is not very good, you can see only roofs of Galata Tower and a piece of Gulhane Park if your room is on the 5th floor. Breakfast is very good and abundant, we had all we could imagine, from dried fruits to scrambled eggs. Staff is helpful and smiling, we were delighted when they handed us a thank you card and a package of turkish coffee on departure. It was very sweet. However, I would recommend them to pay attention to the cleaning of the rooms: it should be done more properly. The bathroom was not very clean, the minibar door was very dirty and the floors were dusty on our arrival. Overall, I recommend this hotel for its price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: KRK46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Ankara, Turkey and would like to spend more weekends in Istanbul to get away. The problem with living in Turkey and Istanbul being so close is having to pay tourist prices at hotels. We recently came across the Hotellino on a recent trip to meet visiting family. The price was reasonable so we gave it a try. I am sure there are other deals out there but we have now found ours in Istanbul. Clean, unique, location, reasonable, great staff, breakfast, owner introduced herself, quaint etc. Will start there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: ipoksane
Reviews.Content: me and my friend stayed at Hotelino 4 nights in October. we wanted to find a hotel in Sirkeci area but as quiet as possible. so we choose Hotellino and it was perfect. hotel is situated on the paralel street to the tram line towards Bosphorus. yet still it is close to all main tourist attractions as well as you can reach Taksim just crossing the Galata bridge. the street itself is surprisingly quiet. about rooms - clean, comfortable with airconditioner and bathroom big enough for two persons. inet access and water is included in room's price. about the breakfast - besides classic choice - cheese, bread, sausage, tomatos, cucumbers, omelet (and many more) there were also nuts, rocket salad (special thanks for this!) and sweets. special thanks to staff - kind, charming, professional and helping. so, wrapping up all that was said - if you are looking for a really good hotel in the very centre of Istanbul, Hotellino is the one.

Reviews.Title: “What a location, what service”
Reviews.Author: Martin C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotellino for a 4 night city break to Istanbul and was absolutely delighted with choice of hotel. The location is excellent, central to so many hot spots yet located just off the main drag so quiet and peaceful. The hotel itself really was fab with excellent staff, breakfasts, great room and very clean and comfortable. The atmosphere, very relaxing reception area and assistance each morning with tips, advice etc just further enhanced the enjoyable experience. I travel extensively on business so staying in a boutique hotel like the Hotellino with staff that really wanted to treat you like a proper guest was a joy and would love to return another time.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: IsabelVM
Reviews.Content: Having been in Istanbul before we were looking for a small. clean and well located boutique hotel and we could not have found a better place. Extremely well located you can either walk or take a train to the main attractions. Within walking distance to the peer where you can board one of the many local boats or take the Bosphorus cruise. THe hotel is extremely clean and modern, good bathroom, good ammenities, free internet and wifi and very good breakfast. The owner is present at breakfast every morning and she is really what you can call the perfect HOSTESS. She gave us very good advise on what to see and what to do since it was not our first trip to Istanbul, whithout her advice we would not have seen so many interesting places and would not have felt so at ease wandering around the city. A special word for the staff in general, they go out of they way to help you in every way they can and they always have a smile on their faces. We will certainly return and we do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MartanneFromOz
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in the centre of the old city so that everything is easily accessible on foot or a short tram (light rail) trip away. Whilst the rooms are typical of many big city hotels, being small with no view, they are well appointed, modern, clean and comfortable. What makes this hotel stand out from the rest is the friendly staff and particularly the owner, who makes sure every morning that you have everything you need and she is very informative about both the "must sees" and where to go to to appreciate everyday life in Istanbul. Breakfast is not to be missed. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet boutique hotel in the old city”
Reviews.Author: SophieandCoco
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice people, very helpful, the owner cared about people's experience there. The rooms and bathrooms are clean, pleasing and certainly comfortable, though small. We liked their breakfasts a lot. Food was good quality, better than some of the bigger hotels. The surrounding environment is not attractive, but you're in the middle of the old city, within walking distance of all the major sites. What you're getting is the convenience of the location, with some of the nicest people in any of the places we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quaint and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Emilio B
Reviews.Content: If you ever want to have a wonderful Turkish experience, try the boutique style hotel experience that the Hotel Hotellin in Istanbul offers. The rooms are impeccable, the staff is very gracious and the hotel is very centrally located in the heart of the old city. Even though it is in the old city, it is easy access to the nightlife of Taksim Square. Every jorning the owner is there to greet and chat with you and offer the best tips for maximizing your time in Istanbul. I had a very early flight and the staff made sure that I was up and a taxi waiting for my trip to the airport. As a small boutique hotel owner as well, this type of service is precisely what travellers are looking for; personalized, friendly and knowledgeable. Had a wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: RobVan888
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful surprise. The very best part of this hotel is the fantastic service! The staff are incredibly warm and helpful. The rooms are small, but very clean & modern. The location is a few blocks away from the "old town" attractions, but within easy walking distance. If we go back to Istanbul, this hotel would definitely be our very first choice!

Reviews.Title: “A great base to get to know Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Miguel B
Reviews.Content: Well-located, immaculately clean, with a great and hearty breakfast and attentive (and English-speaking!) staff, this hotel is the perfect platform for anyone who wants to discover Istambul's main attractions, which are for the most part within walking distance. The owner usually meets guests at breakfast for a chat and a few tourist tips, which adds a nice, personal touch to any stay at Hotellino. Definitely one of those feel-at-home places, impossible not to like, highly recommendable. We'll never need another place to stay in this great city. Plus, by all means don't forget to drop by David Villa, the bar just in front, for a drink or a water pipe, and if you're lucky enough to meet the owner, you're in for a treat: the nicest of guys, the best storyteller in all of Istambul, he's part of a thousand of my holiday memories; I kid you not. This bar's presence only adds to Hotellino's allure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Theresa D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotellino for three nights. The staff was wonderful and made sure that we had a full tourist itinerary for each day of our stay and they helped us make our travel connections in/out of Istanbul. A variety of food was available for the breakfast. Also, all of the sites are in walking distance of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Sylva D
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel for its location, close to all the sights in the old city. All major sights can be reached on foot or with a short ride by tram. If tired from sightseeing, the Gulhane Park is just past the next street, and the piers for sea trips are a short walk. Mine, the hotel owner/manager, is very friendly, takes care to welcome each guest, and gives advice on sightseeing. The hotel rooms are clean and drinking water is always provided. Taxi drivers should be asked to go to the Sirkeci railway station, the hotel is round the corner from there. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “so nice”
Reviews.Author: stephanelamber
Reviews.Content: i adore this hotel, i went over there three times, each time it was a pleasure, they're really adorable with you, they help you, the breakfast is delicious, and they are always ready to help you, rooms are clean and nice , and wifi is great connection, at the end even if this hotel isn't a luxury one, i'll prefer to go each time i'll go to istanbul over there, they let you impression your at home !!

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel to stay in istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Noel M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal hotel because it's well located, all the sites you would want to see are just walking distance. The rooms and lobby are tastefully decorated and are very comfortable and clean. There is free internet, magazines and books to browse in lovely comfy sofas. Breakfast is buffet style with lots of different local and continental goodies to try. But the best thing about this hotel are the owners and the staff who make you feel welcome and go out of their way to help you with anything you need to know or want.

Reviews.Title: “higly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pufftetta
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel almost by chance, suggested by the travel agency owner, and we're happy with the choice. It's a cozy and comfortable tiny hotel, our room (at 5th floor) was surprisingly spatious and well furnished with almost everything you may need (special mention for the large mirror, the power sockets and the clothes hangers with clips). Wi-fi internet connection is free of charge and they provide 1,5 l of spring water per person per day. Rooms and common areas are clean and all the staff is very welcoming and friendly. Main tourist attractions are just a few minutes walk away but the hotel is on a quiet street so you can sleep well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mattfaddy
Reviews.Content: After reading really positive feedback about this hotel we booked mainly for it's location but it became so much more than that. The hotel is immaculate and I assume has been fairly recently renovated but the best bit was the care and attention from the owner / manager who really went out of her way to make sure we got the most out of our stay in Istanbul. All the staff are eager to suggest places to go and restaurants to eat in. They even secretly arranged a cake for our son after overhearing my wife and I talking about his birthday. It's a boutique hotel and other than a great breakfast, doesn't offer any meals but this really is irrelevant as there are a variety of good restaurants on the door step including 'Can' which offers great home cooked Turkish food with friendly service and incredibly cheap prices. As everyone mentions here on Trip advisor it couldn't be better located, less than a minutes walk from the Tram and less than a 10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Archaeological museums, spice market etc. We will definitely be back and hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: colrutter
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful small hotel with very helpful staff proficient in speaking English willing to spend time to explain directions and offer advice as to the many attractions in Istanbul. It is ideally located within the old section of the city within easy walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Basilica Cistern. It is located in a quiet street with a tram service at the end of the street. Buffet breakfast was varied with fresh fruit and a selection of cereals, juices, cheeses and cold cuts. Would definitely recommend this hotel for value, cleanliness and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great People to stay with”
Reviews.Author: Timms801
Reviews.Content: To be honest I was a bit anxious about making reservation in this hotel purely on the basis of reviews and rating but in hindsight I am glad I did, as all the good things said about the hotel in various reviews are absolutely true. We stayed 15 days and loved every minute of it. The Owners and Staff were extremely courteous and helpful. If you are looking for a home away from home, look no further.......they are great people to stay with.

Reviews.Title: “What was expected”
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel D
Reviews.Content: For a ten day visit, if you like the hustle-and-bustle of the big city, I give full recommendations to stay in the Hotellino. It's near to two tram stops. Also at a central location for seeing required tourist sights. Just a short walk to the water(although sadly, no swimming). Cruises leave from an equally close distance. The service in the hotel is kind and generous. The breakfast offers all the essential basics. Not much variation from morning-to-morning, but well enough to enjoy before your sight-seeing journey for when you do leave the hotel for the day. Rooms are cleaned daily along with toiletries re-newed equally as often. Internet is effecient and effective for wireless service. Not much for channels to view, but if you go to Istanbul..you shouldn't be worried so much about the tv!

Reviews.Title: “The search is over!”
Reviews.Author: adam723
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotellino for a week and wanted to stay longer! Rooms: Itâ€™s obvious that a lot of time has gone into the planning of room design, I was very impressed. The size of the room was more than enough for two people. Furniture is very high quality and the small touches in the room such as pictures give it a cosy feel. The air conditioning in the room is very powerful, which is not so in other less quality hotels. The bathroom was spotless and modern with a powerful shower. It also had the interesting feature of a window into the bedroom (you can shut blinds in the window if you don't like the idea!). Not that you will watch much TV in Istanbul but channels included CNN and BBC World Service. The free wifi was quick enough to watch You tube and use Skype. Other nice touches included lovely products to use in the bathroom, 3 free bottles of water per person each day, slippers and robes. Service: This was perhaps the most impressive thing about Hotellino. Staff could not do more to make you feel welcome and give extremely useful advice. We had a warm welcome at the hotel by the receptionist who was at the desk throughout the night (guy with an earring sorry I can't remember your name!). He also spent a lot of time arrange trips and booking restaurants as did the other staff. During breakfast the owner of the hotel gives you priceless advice about the city. She told us about lovely restaurants which are the best I have ever eaten in. A really nice touch was being given a bag of Turkish coffee on check out. If it was not for all of this excellent service from the whole team we would have missed out on some special things which Istanbul has to offer. Location: Hotellino is on a quite street which is a rare thing in this part of Istanbul but round the corner is everything you need. It is 5min walk to a tram stop which gives fast and reliable transport to the rest of the city. It is also a 5-10min walk from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The location could really not be better. Breakfast: Lots of variety including Turkish specialities. After staying at Hotellino for a week I still enjoyed the breakfast. I would stay at Hotellino again without a doubt. Thank you to the team for making our stay such a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that makes you feel Home”
Reviews.Author: Besart87
Reviews.Content: If you ever visit Istanbul which is a great city , you definitly should stay at Hotellino . I spent 7 nights there with my wife on our honey moon and it was great . Very beautiful rooms , spacey , clean and very practic . Everything you need is there . And the breakfast was very delicious and fresh . The staff is amazing , always ready to assist and help you solve every problem . SIMPLY THE BEST !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_vm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotellino for 4 days, and it has everything. Excellent location. Excellent attention from all the persons that work there, the owner is a great guy and at breakfast came to us and gave us recommendations. The hotel is located in a very quite street in Sulthanmet the historic area wich is very crowded and loud so that a great plus when resting, The breakfast is great, buffet style but has lots of Turkish Deilghs that are simply delicious. The rooms are really nicely decorated and are very cozy. The only thing I didnt like, was that the bathrooms in both of our rooms, weren't that clean as we would had liked but we called and they cleaned it and everything was perfect. T

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service - great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: naghaime
Reviews.Content: This was a great place and a great find - thank you TripAdvisor. I booked this place just the day before my flight to Istanbul from Vancouver and I must say, I was so glad that I stayed here. During breakfast, one of the managers would give you a personalized overview of Istanbul and highlight some key places to visit. Amazing customer service! The rooms were spotless and very clean. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable hotel; the small attentions to detail make this a very special place for your stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: bmarsh43
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff was friendly and welcoming without being intrusive. The room was extremely clean, tidy and airy, and the provision of fresh bottled water every day was a very welcome addition. The location of the hotel was ideal for exploring the city, with all the major sites within walking distance. The hotel charges proved very good value for money and we would definitely choose Hotellino should we make a return trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel in historical center”
Reviews.Author: MdE_10
Reviews.Content: All Hotellino's staff is very friendly and heipful. Recently refurbished you can fully enjoy your visit to old Istanbul (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Sultanahmet) because Hotellino is at walking distance and very well connected with tram and other public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to be overly excited about!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMoe36
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for ten nights, to celebrate our 1st anniversary. We booked 10 nights in Istanbul as the destination seemed to see and learn from history that displays east meets west culture. This hotel was chosen upon reading numerous reviews from tripadvisor. Altough me and my wife enjoyed our stay I wanted to be honest and open about my experience at staying at Hotellino. Check In; It was straightforward, and all that was required was copies of our passport and a signature. Room/s; Having insisted we wanted a double room, we were provided with a twin bed room, and the beds had been joined together! We had two single duvet covers and the matteresses were uneven in the middle! Not a great start. Our shower kept becoming blocked and we needed a member a staff to sort this. During our ten night stay we were asked to move in a 'proper' double room, and we got the feeling this was for the hotels convenience to accomodate more guest in the twin room, rather than looking out for us as guest. Internet access; There is a computer in the looby which provides instant fast internet access for guest, although the staff seem to regularly use this computer. They have free wifi access in all the room, however the internet was down for the last few days and there was no urgency for the staff to sort this out even though we had mentioned this on a number of occassions. Breakfast; Simple, continental breakfast with a few local additions such as turkish delights and halwa. To claim a 'boutique hotel' I was dissapointed with the spread. The staff helping out at breakfast were excellent and very helpful to plan your day. Environment; Little did we know that major roadworks was going on outside the hotel, this was very inconvenient, we had to drag our suitcases through cement and dirt and there was constant noise during the day and loud noise from a nearby generator throughout the night. TV; There was only a selection of English speaking channels. No movie channels so you couldnt kick back and relax in the room, only plenty of 'news' channels and channels in other languages. I would suggest undertaking a survey with guest to determine the languages spoken by guest and provide channels in accordance. Rates; The rates at Hotellino in comparision to other nearby hotels, which do have provide 'spa and fitness facilities is high. I booked this hotel upon reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. I would suggest typing in 'Sultanahmet Hotels, Istanbul'. This will refine your search in the Old City and open your search to other nearby hotels which look very good having walked around the area for 10 days, which may not be on Tripadvisor. Chekout; This was simple only requiring my card details, although I did need to silence the reception staff from reading aloud my total bill! Istanbul as a location; We had a wonderful time in Istanbul, particularly visiting the old palaces, mosques and museums. In future we would only stay a maximum of five nights, I think staying 10 night was more than we needed. Many shop workers ask where you come from, this is a tool to persuade you to walk in the shop and prices are provided on this basis! I hope this review helps you decide whether you would want to stay at this hotel or not. My intention is to be open and transparent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Reed13
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotellino. The owner was so helpful with great suggestions on where to go and what to see. Really took an interest in helping us to see the best of Istanbul. All the staff were very welcoming and helpful during our stay. The hotel is very modern but with a very warm, comfortable feel to it. Breakfast was great and the bar was fun for drinks later in the day. Rooms were well appointed and the robes & slippers were a nice added touch. The free water and internet was very thoughtful. Thanks Hotellino for making our trip to Istanbul so special. Lynn & Jim Reed Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rad_backpacker
Reviews.Content: We came in the early morning after night flight with our child. In spite of that they gave as room straight away. Room very modern and very clean. Breakfast was good, small choice but made with good products. Again restaurant was nice and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful.I spoke with the owner and he was a nice guy. It was difficult to find the hotel, consider that is laid in the narrow street and its such a busy area.I would definitely back to Hotellino again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff, ideal location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bat2707
Reviews.Content: An ideal hotel for the independent traveller within easy walking distance of Topkaki Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Basilica Cisterns, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and the tram stop, train station and Bosphorus are only a few minutes walk away. The staff were great and the owners were helpful in planning your days activities. I would recommend this hotel and would use it again. A nice touch on my leaving was to be given a pack of Turkish coffee with instructions on how to make.

Reviews.Title: “We love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanderva
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 4 days 4 nights stay in Istanbul and we loved it. The Hotel Hotellino we found through TripAdvisor, of course, and it was great. We like small modern hotels, and this hotel is among the best. We arrived late â€“ even early; at 02.00 â€“ as flights from Europe to the Middle East can have horrible schedules, but no problem. I had send an email the day before and got a reply then in one minute: you are welcome and we are waiting for you. Yes, they were, very friendly, and the check-in only took a signature and the making of passport-copies. 3 Minutes! Our room was ample for 2 persons with very good beds â€“ we do not like them too soft â€“ perfect bathroom with toilet, tub, shower, many towels and sundry. Good sound-insulation and heating. Plus airco, but we did not have to use that. Free Wifi (with log-in) in room and lobby. Enough wall sockets for your appliances. The breakfast is plentiful for such a small place. No bacon, but that we do not need. Lots of fruits, cereals, condiments, good coffee, breads, cheese, the lot. Served until a comfortable 10:30h. The staff is super friendly and speaks excellent English, with no exceptions. Everyday a breakfast a friendly good morning with a welcoming chat and questions what we were planning and if we needed any help. But had we wished for a silent breakfast that would have been no problem as well. The location is as central as can be, with most big attractions â€“ an uncool term for such world-class sites â€“ in very close by walking distance. Tramway close by as well and a trip to restaurant and shopping district Beyoglu is fun. Boottrips closeby, Turkish baths almost around the corner, take your pick. Taxi to the airport when we left was arrived in 5 minutes, and we got two nice complimentary bags with Turkish coffee from the hotels-staff. In all we felt welcome and safe â€“ also at night - in Istanbulâ€™s streets, without any hassle from vendors or touts.

Reviews.Title: “It's a jewel in Old Town of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dickensEastDennis_MA
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently returned from a fabulous trip to Turkey and I felt I had to share my feelings about our hotel there. It's small and beautifuuly run -- a very attentive and friendly staff, whose knowledge of English is quite impressive. We actually looked forward to our returns to the hotel after sightseeing because we knew we'd get a warm welcome, and good refreshments. There is absolutely nothing negative I would say about our experience there -- put the Hotellino Istanbul on your must-stay list. Richard Yasi East Dennis, MA

Reviews.Title: “A simple but elegant hotel in the heart of the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: keithpp
Reviews.Content: Hotellino is located in the old part of Istanbul. For old read rough. Everything you would wish to see is within easy walking distance â€“ Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Spice Market, Central Market, tramway, the river â€¦ Hotellino is a lovely little hotel, friendly staff. Breakfast consists of simple Middle Eastern fare. Rooms are spacious and clean, but no view other than of a yard. Free water in room. Free internet. Free wi-fi. Fee safe. Free fridge. Turkish delight for breakfast! And halva too! Delicious walnuts and dried apricots. These I added to my muesli. Large pots of jam, a spoonful went well on toast. There was fresh fruit salad but I missed fresh fruit. You are spoilt for choice for places to eat for the rest of the day. Try hot chestnuts off the street vendors and fresh grilled mackerel down by the river. An absolute must is fresh crushed pomegranate juice. The rooms are spacious They lack a decent view, but so what, you have got legs. Plenty of cupboards and drawers. A long glass-topped table with a bench seat which could also serve as a writing desk. Paper and envelopes provided. A notepad and pencil by the bedside. A very good bathroom. Lovely coconut oil shampoo. The soap had a lovely spicy smell, not the usual sweet scent. But what it was I could not say, and try as I did, I could not find any soap like it. An electric hairdryer in the bathroom not a good idea. The bathroom also had a phone! I was baffled by a window from the bedroom into the bathroom, looking into the shower! Maybe some like to put on show! Dotted around the lounge were some excellent books on Istanbul. Passers through leave their books behind for others to share. I suggested Hotellino register as a BookCrossing zone. Very quiet. A level of environmental awareness at Hotellino. The paper used was unbleached, lights turned off when you left the room. But polystyrene cups in the rooms! Not pleasant to drink from and very bad for the environment. I was at a St Josephâ€™s Day Party at Pera Place Hotel and I was given a list of hotels nearby but pleased I did not make the mistake of staying there. A ten Turkish lire taxi ride away from the old part of Istabul and some taxis will try to rip you off with 15 Turkish lire or more. I looked at two other hotels in the old city, Askin Hotel and Askoc Hotel. They had views of the Mosques and the Bosphorus but bad reviews on Trip Advisor on the other hand Hotellino had excellent reviews and it is easy to see why. Whereas many hotels especially those owned by faceless corporations take every opportunity to rip you off, with Hotellino it is what can we do to help you? The staff from the manager down are very helpful and friendly. Not the usual plastic smiles. An ideal hotel for the independent traveller within easy walking distance of places worth visiting and the tram stop and train station are only a few minutes walk away. A nice touch on my leaving was to be given a pack of Turkish coffee with instructions on how to make. I was also on leaving handed a large postcard. The front showing a map of the old part of Istanbul and on the back thanking me for my visit and asking that I post comments on Trip Advisor. This I was more than happy to do as I had anyway been intending to post comments on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and very friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauramas33
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family during the new years eve holidays in Hotellino. The hotel is clean, modern very confortable and central, walking distance from all main interest points in Istanbul: in the old part but with easy access to the new part of the city. The staff is extremely kind, professional,helpful and very attentive. In the occasion of the New Yars festivities we have been given local products to bring home as present and a very warm welcome at our arrival and during all of our stay. The facilities are of a good standard, internet in the rooms and in the lobby, very good breakfast. I strongly advice this hotel for a very pleasant and confortable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by its 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: whynotworld
Reviews.Content: Hotellino is great! The rooms are clean, roomy, and modern. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great--walking distance to the center and right by the tram. Who could ask for more? So it doesn't have a restaurant? There are plenty nearby. So the room doesn't have a view? You're in Istanbul! There's plenty to look at. Really, I can only say good things about Hotellino, and I had been worried when the tour booked us into it. But they knew what they were doing. It's really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: annspan
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as a very good 3 star hotel. The location is ok and within walking distance to most of the sights in the old area but then most of the Istanbul hotels there are the same. It is a little off the way down some side streets and some other hotels would be in a slightly better location. The rooms are clean and no frills as is the bathroom. We had trouble with the lift breaking down a few times b ut this was really no problem. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had no complaints but I would stay somewhere else next time in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “ideal for city sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: effendi8
Reviews.Content: friendly staff (managed by owner), centrally located (walking distance to the major tourist attractions), nice and clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small room”
Reviews.Author: Everywheretraveler
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotellino was great and going to the Sulthanahmet Square could not be easier even for us who are directionally-challenged â€“ we followed the tram track and got to the square within 10 minutes without getting loss. The room was small for two persons with big suitcases. The breakfast was fair but there was a wide variety. The staff was friendly but I was disappointed that we were not given very good advice on restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: colin414
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe little hotel in a great location for the old city. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The plumbing works! Can walk to the tramway and to the Blue Mosque, even the Grand Bazaar if you are in reasonable shape. There's an excellent fish restaurant around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful manager”
Reviews.Author: koutoukoutou2000
Reviews.Content: it was a nice and most importnt clean hotel at the center of istanbul.You can walk to hagia sofia , blue moschow even to taksim square and istiklal street without take any transportation.The manager was very helpful and always willing to give solution for your problems and answer your questions.The breakfast was very nice too.The only one it is bad to this hotel is the view. Thanks for the exchange(nargile-cup) Giannis-Katerina.Greece

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaM1B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location was perfect and the hotel staff very helpful. The rooms were clean and up to date, and also included free bottles of water and breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Boutique B&B in the Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: kazuo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near major tourist attractions and provides clean, minimalist, modern decorated rooms with heartfelt B&B service. The hotel manager/owner is professional and helpful. The staff noticed a person in our party had a birthday during our trip and surprised us with a birthday cake. The staff are all helpful and nice. The hotel is impeccably clean. The rooms have all the necessaries one would find at a nice hotel, including 3 bottles of water per guest per day. Also, wifi internet is included for every room. The hotel is located in very convenient location, within close walking distance to the Sultanahmet and the Galata Bridge. The Sultanahmet isn't for everyone, being tourist central, but it's a great location if you have limited time. Simply a fantastic hotel with first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Pammie60
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks unprepossessing from the outside as there is buliding work going on in the next plot but inside, it is a little haven. The location is great; it's near to the major tourist sights, trams and the Bosphorous and Golden Horn. There are good restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Everything provided in the rooms actually works! There are also extras such as dressing gowns, slippers and loads of bathroom goodies. We had a great 5 days seeing the sites, enjoying great variety of food and drink and also the friendliness of the Turkish people on both sides of the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “super value for location and presentaion”
Reviews.Author: Bogette
Reviews.Content: Hotellino was as good as portrayed in trip adviser.All staff were helpful and pleasant,they accomodated all my needs and went out of their way to always please. I arrived early in Istanbul and had requested if possible an early check in before 0900 this was done with a smile and no problem, much to my delight after a very long flight from Australia. Hotellino is within walking distance of all the major sightseeing places including the Bosphorus and public transport if you wish to venture out further, but walking is the best way to appreciate this wonderful city and it's beautiful people.Some have mentioned the view is poor from this hotel, but you only need to step out around the corner to see history.The marmary project is next door and they are currently excavating ruins from this site which they discovered while digging, this was also exciting to see for me. Breakfast is simple but plentiful enough to keep me going for most of the day, tasty, fresh and healthy. I will definitely return to Hotellino on my next trip to Istanbul,"why fix something if it is not broken"

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, Euro-design boutique hotel close to all.”
Reviews.Author: chachi69
Reviews.Content: Hotellino is exactly as it appears on its website - a clean, new, modern-design hotel. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and the location is great. All the Sultanahmet sites are a five minute walk away, and there are many cafes and bars just one street over. Breakfast was included and though the offerings don't change from day to day, there was a good variety of foods available. There was some construction on the streets in the immediate vicinity when we visited but nevertheless, all was quiet in our fifth floor room with black-out curtains, so we always had a good night's sleep. My only complaint - which I never registered with the hotel - was that the bathroom always had a dank odor. One reviewer wrote that the smell of the cleaning products was "overpowering", but I found myself wondering if they used cleaning products at all in the bathroom or just cleaned it with a wet sponge. But housekeeping did visit every day and did a very nice job tidying up the room and the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the hotel for a single thing, would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Cheeky_Tiger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in March with a friend. We found the hotel to be very clean, and the twin room was attractive (though to be honest the view isn't great, but it never is when the hotel is in the middle of a city) the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only meals we ate in the hotel was breakfast, however the food was really good. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. It is tucked down a side street, and all the major attractions (Bosphorus, Blue Mosque, Bascilica Cister, Spice Bazaar etc) are walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean comfortable and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemike66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotellino in June for a few day. This great hotel offers clean, comfortable modern accommodation at a good price. The smell of the cleaning products were a little overpowering at times. Closely located to many attractions in Sirecki. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: jam1037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotellino in Istanbul in March..The hotel is within walking distance to everything...the Bazaar, the mosques, shopping and the baths. The staff is wonderful and so helpful esp Faruk and Seugi. The rooms are clean and very modern....I would not hesitate to return to this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel- excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: citybreaker
Reviews.Content: Hotellino is located very favourably for sightseeing in Istanbul. It is a relatively new and modern hotel. The good sized rooms and the decor throughout are lovely. The staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. There was some noise from the building works (new Marmara crossing) while we were there, but this wasn't really any more intrusive than the usual city noises. We did ask for a high level room, which was a good idea. We could easily access the old city, the modern quarters (would particularly recommend the Contemporary Art Gallery) and the ferries across the Bosphorus to the Asian side. The nearby Olive Restaurant and Bar had fantastic views across the illuminated old city and across the Bosphorus (plus good food and wine!) Would highly recommend this hotel for an enjoyable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: xpistinaki
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay in Hotellino Istanbul. The room was v. clean, breakfast was v. good and there was a variety, the staff was very friendly and willing to assist at all times. It was located nearby the train station where from we could access Sultanahmet area and Galata very easily. They even arranged for us to go to a hamam. The only drawback was the many mobile phone antennas seen right within a 50m distance from the hotel. Psychologically speaking, you could think that you were inside the source of magnetic radiation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...but...”
Reviews.Author: Nidri
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself was one of the best I've ever been to in terms of distance to transportation, harbour, sights, size of room, anemities etc., in 3 nights stay, we didn't manage to get any sleep at all. The 1st night, a group of tourists from the nearby hotel decided that since they had an early flight next morning, they'd better not sleep at all all night and so should all of the guests in the nearby hotels. They kept screaming and partying outside the hotel all night long, so no sleep the 1st night. Upon arrival we noticed a construction work in progress just outside the hotel making a lot of noise. Well, they kept working all day and all night long!!!! All night!!!! Believe it!!! The noise was horrible... So, great hotel but not for relaxation after a tiring day walking aroung the city... But on the other hand these were things the hotel couldn't do anything about... We would stay at this hotel again but only if the construction work was over.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find! Yes in all aspectsâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: mariusb
Reviews.Content: Location, service, atmosphere, roomsâ€™ design â€“ all just great (if you can find a rate under 100â‚¬ even better!) PS: mind the noise coming from the nearby construction site of Marmara project (Friday midnight â€œbonusâ€� on our stay: hammer drills!!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the city tour”
Reviews.Author: Dymsha
Reviews.Content: Location: close to the heart of Istanbul. 10 -15 minutes to Top Kapi, Aja Sofia, boat station, Grand Bazaar. Tram line will help to get to the Taksim in 10 minutes. It is easy to get to the hotel from Ataturk airport by metro + tram (2*1.5TL). Taxi from airport had cost me 40TL. There is the grocery shop on the next street, a lot of cafes. Room is small. 2 beds + 0.5 meters around + narrow long table, TV, bar, free safe box, wardrobe in the hall. Beds are good, tough matrass. There is no coffee set but 3*0.5 liter of aqua per person every day for free. Mostly silence from the street, poor sound-proofing of the next room. Bathroom: hip bath, hairdryer (poor), bathrobe + slippers. All furniture is in very good condition. Pleasant staff, English breakfast, free PC with internet access, free Wi-Fi, Summary: Taking into consideration that I paid Euro 42 a day per double and the reason for the trip was to visit historical city this hotel fully met my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, friendly and helpful staff, fresh bright and clean, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Turktaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotellino as part of our honeymoon. The room at the top floor had some views of the sea and a small balcony. The room itself was larger than average and very clean. Breakfast were Ok with plenty of hot coffee on tap - just what we needed. The hotel is located in a good position in a quiet road but near the main tourist attractions. We even found out that you can get to the airport by tram and metro train for only 6 lira per person (its 40 lira by taxi). The staff always tried to help us telling us about places and restuarants to visit and they even gave us a city map guide to help. We would definitely stay there again next time we are in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Magificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: via2009
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel: location is great, and the staff is wonderfull. We went to celebrate my girlfriendÂ´s birthday, and although we havenÂ´t said anything to the hotelÂ´s staff, they surprised us and sang happy birthday (they even bought a birthday cake!). What else can you ask for?Room was spacious, modern and clean.We felt as if we were at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay after Booking Error”
Reviews.Author: MAWander
Reviews.Content: First thing's first - I enjoyed my stay at Hotellino very much and would recommend it to anyone looking for convenient, stylish accomodation at this price. However, I must say how extremely disappointed I was to have booked a full 6 months ahead, and to have received a confirmation from the hotel one week prior to my stay, only to find that there was no room available for me upon arrival. The staff, then, took me to a very mediocre hotel across the street; the room I was given was dark, musty and with an attrocious bathroom that absolutely stank of sewer. See pics below. This room should not have any relation to Hotellino; however, I wasted time unpacking and re-packing, checking in here and checking in there, and one night of my holiday was spent in quite sub-standard accomodation for which, at the end of my stay, Hotellino offered a very modest compensation of 50% off for one night. Yes, the staff apologized. Yes, they went out of their way to be sure I was comfortable afterwards. But I did, nonetheless, feel somewhat cheated by the experience. My room at Hotellino, however, was quite nice; small and modern, nicely furnished, comfortable bed and spotlessly clean bathroom, in-room safe, etc. View was nothing to write home about, but who comes to Istanbul to look out the window? The hotel, not even a year old at this point, is in great condition and everything's very nice. I loved the breakfast and found that there was always plenty of choice; if some item of food ran low during the breakfast rush, the lovely staff would instantly bring more. Fruit salad was particularly nice, as was the fresh arrugula, parsley and tomato and great cheeses. Very good coffee, as well. The staff are young and friendly, helpful and chatty; hotel is small enough so that you can get to know them a bit and have a laugh. Sevgi, in particular, was a delight, and offered lots of suggestions for transport and places to visit. But all the staff - at the desk and in the cafe - were really pleasant. For a first time visitor to Istanbul, the location can't be beat. Hotellino is within walking disatance to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Sirkeci Station and ferry boats of Eminonu. Just great. Lots of places to eat and enjoy in the neighborhood, and the tram, from where you can get anywhere, is only a two minute walk away. If it weren't for the booking error, the night's stay in squalor, and the less than generous compensation for the hotel's error - all of which angered me beyond belief - I'd have written that the stay at Hotellino was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “It's a pleasure to stay!”
Reviews.Author: katerinamou_
Reviews.Content: Hottelino is a very pleasant hotel. It is very clean, its staff was very helpful and kind. It made us feel like home. Breakfast is fairly decent, although I think that some food (e.g. croissants) needed refilling!! The room was nice, there was always warm water. It is located in a very good position and it is near to the most famous sightseeings (Topcapi, Blue Mosce and the marvelous Agia Sofia Church). We would stay pleasantly again in the same hotel and we highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: taxi75
Reviews.Content: the hotel is idealy situated to visit most of the sites of interest on foot. the staff were all very friendly and helpful.they made our stay most memorable and enjoyable and could not have looked after us better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucinator
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for 5 nights and everything was perfect. Staff is unbelievable friendly and helpful and so is the manager. Rooms are modern and very clean. Good beds, nice bathroom, many gadgets as bathing robes etc. The hotel is located near some of Istanbul's main attractions but if you'd like to eat really good food it's worth taking the short tramway trip to the other side of the Galata bridge. Lots of excellent restaurants there on the hill. Not far away from the hotel though is a very nice bakery called "Hafiz Mustafa". Just ask the staff how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: vargues
Reviews.Content: In my first visit to Turkey, it was a pleasent surprise to find such a nice hotel in the center of Istanbul. I stayed in this hotel from the 19th till the 26th of February. Great central location, very clean, totaly renewed and with very attentive and dedicated staff that made you feel at home. On my last evening, it was my birthday and I was surprised with a birthday cake, making it a very touching detail for my memories. I would definetely recomend this hotel to visitors of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel with all amenities and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: anjo10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in this hotel and as reviews already stated the staff is very helpful and rooms are very nicely done. Everything works properly,breakfast is very nice and the location is superb near the main attractions,most of them within a few minutes walk. Staff will do all they can to make you feel at home and another very small but practically very convenient gesture,there are 3 half liters of mineral water per person in your fridge every day for free. Highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: theodore_aneza
Reviews.Content: it was our first time in Istanbul and it we ll remember it forever. This hotel was like a home for us. The staff was very friendly, polite and helpfull and they made everything they could to serve and help us in any way. It was like we had a local friend and we could ask for anything. The hotel was better than we expected, it's brand new with all the modern ammenities, spacious rooms, very clean and with really good prices. Its location is ideal since its in a walking distance to all the tourist interesting sites as Ayia Sofia, Blue Mosque, The Bazzar, Top Kapi, the port where we took a boat for Bosphorus cruise and next to a tram station that takes you everywhere. the only thing that could be better was the breakfast but it was adequate for its category. We stronlgy recommend Hotellino to everyone, especially young couples like us and we are definitely going to stay there to our next visit

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprice”
Reviews.Author: Amalyaa
Reviews.Content: Definitly this is the hotel to stay at in Istanbul. Clean rooms and new furniture (just as the photos on their website show). Breakfast was nice as well,meaning that the food was fresh and enaugh,even though sort of repetative. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The only downside is the location,meaning that you won't have a nice view from your window but at least it is not noisy at all. It is very close to the tram station as well and there are a lot of restaurants and shops in the area. I'll definitly choose Hotellino again next time i visit istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: dancingvoyager
Reviews.Content: I searched for hotels on line and came across Hotellinos website, the pictures gave a good indication that the hotel had been well thought out, The rooms were spacious and very clean. Staff were helpful and friendly, We even received a box of turkish delights as a New Years gift. Although the actual street that the hotel was located on was not the prettiest, it was very close to both the Bosphorous and important places to see such as the Blue Mosque. We were given excellent indications on how to arrive at the hotel. Breakfast was simple but plentiful, and i would highly recommend this hotel for travellers such as myself, who are looking for quality at a very reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “LESS IS MORE...”
Reviews.Author: tge_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this place for 5 nights and spent X-mas in Istanbul. The hotel is small, clean, has really nice staff and a modest restaurant. Placed in the heart of Sirkeci, the district of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the most wonderful Topkapi Palace, the hotel is totally convenient for a city trip of a few days. The rooms are modern and very clean with very well fitted bathrooms. Staff are incredibly helpfull and friendly and have made our stay wonderful. You might want to check with the hotel about the best way to transfer from and to the airport. Otherwise make sure you have the hotel's telephone number for your cabbie so they can help him find it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Ottomaan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this modern hotel for 5 nights (December 2009). Very friendly staff, and a clean hotel in the district Sirkeci (especially the bathroom was nice). By the way 3 bottles water and Turkish tea were free per day. The area was not so clean and inconvenient, the hotel was even hard to find. Anyway it is nearby the prominent touristic attractions. The breakfast was standard, not so much variation. Be careful when you want to book at de Jong Intra Vakanties, because the transfer is not included and the staff is not friendly at all. If you need a friendly/honest cabdriver, you can call Oguzhan [--]. He can also guide and recommend the best places in Istanbul. What a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Hijooo
Reviews.Content: I spend ten days in friendly environment during my visit to Istanbul in Hotillino Istanbul Specially my friend Fawk

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: GeeVeeTee
Reviews.Content: Hotellino is a wonderful little hotel. The staff are very friendly and know the meaning of customer service. Our room on the top floor was very quiet, the food was great and it's one of the few places we've been, where hanging out in the lobby/cafe with a beer or wine after a busy day exploring the city is something that is inviting, relaxing and enjoyable. We would definitely recommend this hotel, it might take a few extra minutes to walk to the main attractions, but it's location just away from the hustle & bustle of Sultanahmet make it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Bravissimo!”
Reviews.Author: dakinky
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel!Nothing bad to say! It is cosy, clean , very nice and frindly stuff! Very close almost to everything even by foot. What ever we asked, we had it! No hasitation of selecting this hotel! You will be pleased with everything!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and easy access to top 5 sites of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: diethnis
Reviews.Content: We are a multinational family, Greek man and Hungarian woman with 2 and half years old child. We had a wonderful time at this new hotel, which opened few months ago. Quiet, clean and above all genuine hospitality by the polite and friendly young staff. We felt like home. Nice breakfast and time at the little hotel restaurant. Easy access to top touristic sites of Istanbul. Certainly we shall be back there.

Reviews.Title: “friendly modern small hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgmit123
Reviews.Content: Great location near transport hub and main sites. Really helpful staff made it a home from home for our short stay. We had a good sized corner room. Turkish breakfast with great variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and stay”
Reviews.Author: Excellent_choice
Reviews.Content: This was my fisrt trip to Istanbul and the Hotellino was great value to stay. Nice staff, clean and new room with good size. Hotel location is perfect, close to best attractions in the Old City, good restaurants around and very quiet. I booked through their Web site and they promise transfer from airport but when I confirmed the booking they sad the promotion was only for the last month (looks like a promo strategy that doesnÂ´t fit with the hotel services).

Reviews.Title: “Like they say, even better”
Reviews.Author: SandDLugano
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on internet, we read some reviews then we chose this hotel. We were in Istanbul just 5 days so we needed an hotel near the tourist attractions and possibly in a quiet part of the city. Obiviously clean and not too expensive. What we found was the perfect fusion of all our needs. A special mention to the staff: young, smiling and nice. S&D

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, good location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcusWebster
Reviews.Content: We booked via the homepage of the hotel. They confirmed our booking and answered all of our questions immediately. They organised for us the transfer from airport (30 EUR). A guy waited us with a name shield and a comfortable Mercedes Vito carried two us to the hotel. The welcoming was friendly and helpful. The hotel is modern, nice and comfortable. They tidy the room every day and change the towels as well. Location is good if you want to visit Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Byzantine Cystern, our the legendary Grand Bazaar, but can travel to everywhere because of the good public transport. The nearest tram station is about 100 meters from the hotel. The staff helped us to answer all of our questions and got a free half day city tour. Choose this hotel if you travel to Istanbul and won't get upset!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotellino Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Hoca Pasa Mah. Nobethane Cad. | No: 5 Sirkeci, Istanbul 34134, Turkey
